meta.genre: Relaxing puzzle, zen mining, sorting simulator

pitch.tagline: Break rocks, collect minerals, sort at your own pace—closure without stress.
pitch.target_audience: Busy adults seeking calm and accomplishment
pitch.unique_selling_point: No timers, no penalties—pure satisfying tidying simulation with pixel art charm.

steps: Destroy: Player clicks rock → it shatters → releases 5-15 mineral particles
Collect: Minerals scatter (2D physics) → player collects via auto-zone or tap
Sort: Player drags minerals into bins (by color/shape/rarity) → earn points
Repeat: New rocks spawn → unlock better tools and new biomes
core_loop.loop_flow: Destroy → Collect → Sort → Repeat (no fail state, no timers)

systems.name: Destruction and Physics
systems.description: Click rock to reduce HP → break triggers particle scatter with 2D physics → minerals settle within 3 seconds

systems.name: Mineral Generation
systems.description: Data-driven loot tables (minerals.json) define colors, shapes, rarities, and point values
key_features: Weighted random generation per rock type

systems.name: Collection
systems.description: Auto-collect zone (100px radius) or manual tap → minerals fly to inventory with animation

systems.name: Sorting
systems.description: Drag-drop minerals into bins (criteria: color, shape, rarity) → correct sort rewards points

systems.name: Scoring (Non-Punishing)
systems.description: Points are positive reinforcement only—no penalties for slow play or mistakes
key_features: Optional combo: +25 for 5 correct in row (no penalty on break)

systems.name: Progression (Comfort-First)
systems.description: Unlock new rocks, tools, and biomes at organic pace (no grind)
key_features: Unlocks: new rock types, +minerals, pickaxe tool, custom bins, Zen Mode

pc.layout: Top: score + settings | Middle: playfield (rocks + minerals) | Bottom: inventory + sorting bins

mobile.layout: Portrait: Top 10% info | Middle 40% playfield | 20% inventory strip | Bottom 30% bins (thumb zone)
mobile.ergonomics: One-handed play, bottom UI elements in thumb reach

art_direction.style: 2D pixel art (16x16 or 32x32 base sprites, scaled 2x-4x)
art_direction.mood: Cozy, soft, slightly stylized (Stardew Valley meets A Short Hike)

audio.music_style: Ambient, lo-fi, minimal piano/synth, no percussion, layered pads

engine.name: Godot
engine.rationale: Open-source, excellent 2D workflow, cross-platform (PC/Web/Mobile), GDScript for fast iteration, no royalties

core_modules.name: RockBreaker
core_modules.responsibility: Detect clicks, reduce HP, trigger break event

core_modules.name: MineralSpawner
core_modules.responsibility: Roll loot table, spawn minerals with physics

core_modules.name: SortingSystem
core_modules.responsibility: Validate drag-drop, award points, manage bins

core_modules.name: ProgressionManager
core_modules.responsibility: Track unlocks, check triggers, save state

config_files.contains: Mineral definitions (id, name, shape, color, rarity, points, sprite)
Rock types (HP, sprite, loot tables, weights)

optimizations: Batch sprites into TextureAtlas (reduce draw calls)

Loops seamlessly, volume at 30%, no clicks/pops

risks.mitigation: Implement object pooling (Week 2), limit particles to 75 on web, profile early (Week 3)
Prototype sorting in Week 3, playtest with 3+ users, add snap-to-bin magnetism if needed
Design scores as 'bonus' not 'goal', playtest emphasis (Week 6), add 'Hide Score' toggle if negative feedback
Use free pixel art placeholders (itch.io, OpenGameArt), commission 1-2 key sprites only if time allows
Lock MVP to PC-only, document mobile design in separate spec (Week 8), no mobile work until MVP validated

quantitative.measurement: Track time from game start to quit (analytics)
% of sessions where player completes ≥1 bin before quitting
% of players who return within 24 hours (LocalStorage timestamp)
% players who toggle 'Hide Score' (stress reduction proxy)

qualitative.method: Optional survey: 'How relaxed do you feel?' (1-5 scale)
Survey: 'Did you feel a sense of accomplishment?' (Yes/No)

behavioral_signals: Long idle times between actions (player savoring, not rushing)
Repeated bin completion actions (enjoys closure moment)
Playtime at night (20:00-23:00) indicates wind-down usage

development_timeline.week_1_2: Core loop prototype (rock breaking + mineral spawn, gray boxes)
development_timeline.week_4: Art pass 1 (replace placeholders with pixel art: rocks, 6 minerals)
development_timeline.week_8: Testing + bug fixes (internal playtest, balance tweaks)
